DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It'll take some time, but I could learn to like it here.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm so glad to hear you say so. and promise I'll work hard to make sure that you do.
DIALOGUE AFTER: NewtonOberly: You should know that many of us consider it a great honor to have you here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The only place I want to call home was destroyed a long time ago.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm truly sorry. This must all be terribly difficult for you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: NewtonOberly: You should know that many of us consider it a great honor to have you here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I think it's a little too science-fiction for my taste.
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course, I understand. Nearly all of us were born here, but you come form a very different world.
DIALOGUE AFTER: NewtonOberly: You should know that many of us consider it a great honor to have you here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What do you do here?
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm in charge of housing and provisions.
It's my mission to ensure that everyone lives a comfortable and productive life.
DIALOGUE AFTER: NewtonOberly: You should know that many of us consider it a great honor to have you here.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm so glad to hear you say so. and promise I'll work hard to make sure that you do.
RESPONSE TEXT: You should know that many of us consider it a great honor to have you here.
Welcome, welcome! It's so good to meet you. I truly hope you'll come to think of the Institute as your home.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It'll take some time, but I could learn to like it here.
SCRIPT NOTES: Very friendly, perhaps laying it on a bit thick

RESPONSE TEXT: Good to see you. Feeling well today?
I hope all your needs are being seen to. You just let me know if they're not.
People on the surface have got it pretty bad. Makes me thankful for being down here.
When the lights go down and the stars come out, a man just forgets all his troubles.
Our newest synths are so lifelike, I keep mistaking them for real people.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Newton: I gathered these items together for you. I think you'll find them useful.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.
I suppose I should also make the funeral arrangements.
Well, there's much to do, so I'll get about it. In the meantime, I'm sure everyone will be relieved that this is over.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm just glad they listened to reason.
RESPONSE TEXT: Indeed.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Keeping our food supply secure is your responsibility. This better not happen again.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'll make it my top priority.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm starting to get used to that.
RESPONSE TEXT: I apologize. I won't doubt you again.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What do you mean "you feared the worst?"
RESPONSE TEXT: I just didn't want to see anyone get hurt.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: There's no need to drag this out. I believe they learned their lesson.
RESPONSE TEXT: Your compassion and understanding speak well of you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Companion: Cait interjects

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They were prepared to let everyone starve to death. They have to die.
RESPONSE TEXT: I... I understand. I'll make the necessary arrangements, though it saddens me to do so.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They were prepared to let everyone starve to death. They have to die.
RESPONSE TEXT: What?! Execute them? But that's not how we do things here.
Please, I beg you, choose something else. Anything.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: There's no need to drag this out. I believe they learned their lesson.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They were prepared to let everyone starve to death. They have to die.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm sorry, but I won't do that. We're not savages.
I must insist that you choose another form of punishment.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: There's no need to drag this out. I believe they learned their lesson.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Put them on probation. Limit their access to quarters and non-working areas.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's more than fair. I'll see to it that everyone's notified.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Companion: Cait interjects

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Give them supplies and then throw them out. They're banned for life.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wish I could say that would be unfair, but there's no denying those men put all our lives at risk.
I'll see to those supplies. At least they'll have a fighting chance, which is perhaps more than they deserve.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Companion: Cait interjects

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Newton: I'll take that holotape back.
RESPONSE TEXT: I also wanted to offer you something as a more personal expression of gratitude.
I know that your work often takes you to the surface where supplies are scarce.
I gathered these items together for you. I think you'll find them useful.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.

RESPONSE TEXT: There is one further matter to discuss.
Obviously, some kind of disciplinary action must be taken here. The question of what form it takes is up to you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: There's no need to drag this out. I believe they learned their lesson.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The food supply is secure. I'd still call that a win.
RESPONSE TEXT: In the short-term, perhaps, but choosing violence always carries a cost.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Stop whining and be grateful I got your food supply back.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, of course. Sorry if I seemed ungrateful.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The important thing is that we got the food supply back.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're right, of course.
When Higgs and Loken chose their path, they chose the consequences that go with it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What was I supposed to do, let everyone starve?
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't meant to preach. I simply wish that matters could have been resolved more peacefully.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I'll see that the mess in Hydroponics is cleaned up.

RESPONSE TEXT: Here we are. Just give me a moment...
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: There, it's unlocked.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Newton: Here we are. Just give me a moment...
RESPONSE TEXT: There, it's unlocked.
For goodness' sake, be reasonable!
SCRIPT NOTES: Frustrated... shouting through a door at someone / Irritated

RESPONSE TEXT: I know you can hear me, now open this door!
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: Oh, what's the use.
SCRIPT NOTES: Angry... shouting through a door at someone / Angry

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Newton: I know you can hear me, now open this door!
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, what's the use.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: PlayerVoiceFemale01: What's going on?
RESPONSE TEXT: Doctor Higgs and Doctor Loken have decided to protest your appointment as Father's successor.
They've taken control of the BioScience security systems and cut off our food supply.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sure they'll calm down in time.
RESPONSE TEXT: I know these men, and I can assure you they're completely serious.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe I can reason with them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They've lost their minds.
RESPONSE TEXT: No, they've lost faith.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe I can reason with them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Oh, great. Like I don't have enough problems.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well I'm sorry you've been inconvenienced, but solving personnel issues is part of an administrator's job.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe I can reason with them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Have they made any demands?
RESPONSE TEXT: Not yet, but I expect they'll demand that you renounce all ties to the Institute.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe I can reason with them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Maybe I can reason with them.
RESPONSE TEXT: I believe I can help with that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I can unlock the maintenance tunnel that leads to the BioScience observation room.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's one thing to protest, but this is going way too far.
RESPONSE TEXT: Look, I can see that you're angry, but please, talk to them before resorting to more violent measures.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I can unlock the maintenance tunnel that leads to the BioScience observation room.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: This isn't going to change anything.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well, perhaps if you could just talk to them, this could all be resolved peacefully.
In fact, I think I can help you with that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I can unlock the maintenance tunnel that leads to the BioScience observation room.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Is there a way I can communicate with them?
RESPONSE TEXT: As a matter of fact, there is.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I can unlock the maintenance tunnel that leads to the BioScience observation room.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I believe I can help with that.
RESPONSE TEXT: I can unlock the maintenance tunnel that leads to the BioScience observation room.
From there, you should be able to communicate with Higgs and Loken.
If you can't reason with them, you can use this holotape to access the command functions on the observation room terminal.
That should give you some options. Just please, try to talk to them first. Use violence only as a last resort.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Your compassion and understanding speak well of you.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'll take that holotape back.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Newton: I also wanted to offer you something as a more personal expression of gratitude.

RESPONSE TEXT: Remember, they control the defense systems. Be careful
For what it's worth, I have every confidence in you. Higgs and Loken do not speak for all of us.
I can understand why Higgs and Loken are frustrated. To not be consulted on a decision of that magnitude must feel like an insult.
There's an opportunity here to demonstrate your ability to lead. I hope you'll make the most of it.
In all my years, I've never seen anything like this. The sheer impertinence of it!
Doctor Higgs has always been one to complain. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised by this.
It's damned selfish, that's what it is!
I begged them to stop this nonsense before you returned, but of course they wouldn't listen.
I'm as frustrated right now as I've ever been. I just can't believe this.
It's not too late to change your minds!

RESPONSE TEXT: No good can come of this, Lawrence. You won't win!
SCRIPT NOTES: Shouting through a closed door at someone

RESPONSE TEXT: This is just unbelievable.
In all my years, I have never seen such nerve!
That was... unfortunate. We don't like violence here, and I fear your actions will have consequences.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: The food supply is secure. I'd still call that a win.

RESPONSE TEXT: Bravo! I admit, I was fearing for the worst, but I can see that I underestimated you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm just glad they listened to reason.

RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, well, it seems we're at an impasse.
I understand that they feel slighted, but it won't change anything.
Your son will leave a lasting legacy here. He truly was a great man and a great leader.

RESPONSE TEXT: I wasn't sure about you, not at first. Now I can see why Father chose you to lead us.

RESPONSE TEXT: I'm not going to miss everyone complaining about insufficient power levels.

RESPONSE TEXT: Things have changed for the better since you arrived. Looks like Father was right all along.
For what it's worth, I think you're a fine choice to take Father's place.
I'm sure some of the others will question your appointment as our next director. Don't let it bother you.

RESPONSE TEXT: So, Doctor Ayo thinks he can hide in his office, does he?
Well, you can tell him that I intend to speak to Father about these unannounced security sweeps of yours.
Ransacking my quarters in the middle of the night is totally unacceptable.
